description: This file contains startup and environment validation logic for a Python-based backend service. It includes functions to fetch environment variables, determine the effective search provider, check for the presence of a Bing API key, and validate that necessary environment variables are set correctly during application startup. The main function 'validate_environment' raises RuntimeErrors if required configurations are missing or inconsistent, and logs the current CORS settings and search provider configuration.

methods.name: bool _env_bool(name: str, default: bool = False)
methods.description: Parses boolean-like environment variable values, returning a boolean.

methods.name: List[str] _env_list(name: str, default: Optional[List[str]] = None)
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated list environment variable into a list of strings.

methods.name: str _effective_search_provider()
methods.description: Determines the normalized search provider ('auto', 'bing', etc.) based on environment variables.

methods.name: bool _has_bing_key()
methods.description: Checks if a Bing or search API key is set in environment variables.

methods.name: bool _should_require_bing_key(provider: str)
methods.description: Decides whether a Bing key is required based on the search provider.

methods.name: None validate_environment()
methods.description: Main function that validates critical environment settings at app startup, raising errors if misconfigured and logging current CORS and search configuration.
